page.title: 10ALL SAINTS CHURCH,BRANT RD.
page.content: Between the years 1013-1066 Lincoln was under the rule of the Danes.The city had 50 years of peace and in these years it was the centre of international trade.It was in these years that All-Saints was built.{The {nave}was built in this period.Its four corners can still be seen (3 from the outside)and the blocked up north door was built in this period but was reset stone by stone when the aisle was built on.{In 1066}the tower was built on to the nave in late Saxon /early Norman style.The chancel arch was probably built at the same time.The church was enlarged in Early English style in the 13th century.The south aisle was built and its pillars were a copy from the cathedral.The Chancel was lengthened and the altar could no longer be seen from the nave.The 2 windows in the chancel made at then.
